data.name: SensitiveDataInfoText
data.value: This connection string appears to contain sensitive data (for example, a password) that is required to connect to the database. Storing sensitive data in the connection string can be a security risk. Do you want to include this sensitive data in the connection string?

data.name: StartPage_EmptyModelText
data.value: Creates an empty entity model as a starting point for visually designing a conceptual model from the toolbox. Object-layer code is generated from the model. Later, you can either update the model from a database or generate a storage model, mappings, and database script from the model.

data.name: StartPage_GenerateFromDBText
data.value: Creates an entity model from a database. Object-layer code is generated from the model. This option also lets you specify the database connection, settings for the model, and database objects to include in the model.

data.value: Empty Model Code First - description placeholder.

data.name: SelectTables_PluralizeCheckbox
data.value: Pluralize or &singularize generated object names

data.name: PluralizeCheckBoxToolTipText
data.value: Makes names in the model more descriptive and accurate by ensuring that EntityType names are singular, EntitySet names are plural, and Navigation Properties are singular or plural based on their multiplicity.

data.name: SelectTablesPage_IncludeForeignKeys
data.value: Include foreign &key columns in the model

data.name: SelectTablesPage_IncludeForeignKeysToolTip
data.value: Includes foreign key columns as properties in the model.

data.name: PluralizeCheckBoxDisabledToolTipText
data.value: Pluralization services are only available on English versions of Visual Studio.

data.value: Launch Wizard on &Drag and Drop operations from Server Explorer

data.name: ErrorCouldNotParseDdlFileName
data.value: The given DDL file path, '{0}', could not be parsed due to the exception: '{1}'. Please take the appropriate steps to address this exception before proceeding.

data.name: ErrorNoDdlParentDir
data.value: The given DDL file path, '{0}', does not have a parent directory. Please specify a path that has an existing parent directory before proceeding.

data.name: LocalDataConvertConnectionText
data.value: The connection you selected uses a local data file that is not in the current project. Would you like to copy the file to your project and modify the connection?

data.name: LocalDataErrorAddingFile
data.value: An error occurred while adding the local data file {0} to the project {1}

data.name: LocalDataExceptionCopyingFile
data.value: Caught exception of type {0} attempting to copy file {1}. Error message: {2}

data.name: ErrorDdlPathNotFile
data.value: The file name could not be determined from the given DDL file path '{0}'. Please specify a valid path to a file before continuing.

data.name: ErrorResolvingProjectFile
data.value: There was an error resolving a URI from the project file path '{0}' in the process of resolving the DDL file path. This project type may be unsupported.

data.name: CreateFunctionImportsCheckBoxToolTipText

data.name: RuntimeConfigPage_Title
data.value: Choose Your Version

data.name: RuntimeConfig_BelowSixInstalled
data.value: Your project references an older version of Entity Framework. To use the latest version, exit this wizard and upgrade before performing this action.

data.name: RuntimeConfig_Net35
data.value: Your project targets .NET Framework 3.5. To use the latest version of Entity Framework, exit this wizard and change your project's target framework to .NET Framework 4.0 or higher before performing this action.

data.name: RuntimeConfig_NoProvider
data.value: An Entity Framework database provider compatible with the latest version of Entity Framework could not be found for your data connection. If you have already installed a compatible provider, ensure you have rebuilt your project before performing this action. Otherwise, exit this wizard, install a compatible provider, and rebuild your project before performing this action.

data.name: RuntimeConfig_SixInstalledButNoProvider
data.value: Your project references the latest version of Entity Framework; however, an Entity Framework database provider compatible with this version could not be found for your data connection. If you have already installed a compatible provider, ensure you have rebuilt your project before performing this action. Otherwise, exit this wizard, install a compatible provider, and rebuild your project before performing this action.

data.name: CodeFirstCodeFile_CtorComment_CS
CodeFirstCodeFile_DbSetComment_CS
data.value: // Add a DbSet for each entity type that you want to include in your model. For more information // on configuring and using a Code First model, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=390109.

data.name: CodeFirstCodeFile_CtorComment_VB
data.value: ' Your context has been configured to use a '{0}' connection string from your application's ' configuration file (App.config or Web.config). By default, this connection string targets the ' '{1}.{0}' database on your LocalDb instance. ' ' If you wish to target a different database and/or database provider, modify the '{0}' ' connection string in the application configuration file.

data.name: CodeFirstCodeFile_DbSetComment_VB
data.value: ' Add a DbSet for each entity type that you want to include in your model. For more information ' on configuring and using a Code First model, see http:'go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=390109.
